books.author: by David Grann
books.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil.
books.name: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON

books.author: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.
books.name: OUTLIVE

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Mustafa Suleyman with Michael Bhaskar
books.description: A co-founder of the A.I. company DeepMind posits how new technology might affect the global order and our daily lives.
books.name: THE COMING WAVE

books.author: by Joe Posnanski
books.description: The author of “The Baseball 100” brings to life 50 moments in baseball’s history.
books.name: WHY WE LOVE BASEBALL

books.author: by Franklin Foer
books.description: A staff writer at The Atlantic portrays the first two years of the Biden presidency, with a focus on Biden’s use of deal-making and compromise.
books.name: THE LAST POLITICIAN

books.author: by David Grann
books.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.
books.name: THE WAGER

books.author: by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin
books.description: A biography of J. Robert Oppenheimer. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize in 2006 and an inspiration for the film “Oppenheimer.”
books.name: AMERICAN PROMETHEUS

books.author: by Drew Gilpin Faust
books.description: The former Harvard president and author of “This Republic of Suffering” describes the misogyny and racism that compelled her to become a historian.
books.name: NECESSARY TROUBLE

books.author: by Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.
books.name: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: by Maria Bamford
books.description: The comedian details her encounters with show business and anonymous fellowship groups.
books.name: SURE, I'LL JOIN YOUR CULT

books.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.name: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS

books.author: by Ed Yong
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning science writer explains the sensory perceptions and ways of communication used by a variety of animals.
books.name: AN IMMENSE WORLD

books.author: by Robert P. Jones
books.description: The president and founder of Public Religion Research Institute connects some historical events with the legacy of white supremacy.
books.name: THE HIDDEN ROOTS OF WHITE SUPREMACY

books.author: by Michelle Zauner
books.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.
books.name: CRYING IN H MART
